This uses System.Console instead of ConsoleControl to read keys into a
SecureString in a portable manner. The Windows implementation is left
untouched.

Resolves #470, #715, #1179, and #1143.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: I want to write tests for `Get-Credential`, but `ConvertFrom-SecureString` needs implementing too.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: This also mostly implements ReadLineFromConsole using `System.Console` for portability. While we did not think we needed this as we have PSReadLine, it is necessary for `Read-Host` and prompting.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: Still need to fix `SecureStringHelper.cs` for Linux, and write `Get-Credential` tests.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @vors, @JamesWTruher can you guys hunt down any real `Get-Credential` and prompting tests?

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
@vors I think the fix for the SecureString cmdlets should be separate from this. Can you sign-off?

Also note that it's not worth more time attempting to write expect tests for Get-Credential, and for killing Read-Host with Ctrl-C. @JamesWTruher and I tried valiantly.
